version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Clock face symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: Twelve O‚Äôclock was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name ‚ÄúClock Face Twelve O'Clock‚Äù and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015. Copy a http://emojipedia.org/clock-face-twelve-oclock/
emoji_net_data.name: twelve o‚Äôclock

bn:00026000n: A light meal usually eaten around midday, notably when not as main meal of the day.
Tiffin is an English slang term of second breakfast or lunch, sometimes applied to any light meal.
Lunch, an abbreviation of luncheon, is a midday meal of varying size depending on the culture.
A formal meal served in the middle of the day.
A light midday meal or snack; luncheon
A light meal eaten during the day

bn:00044075n: Time of day when the sun is in its zenith; twelve o'clock in the day, midday.
Midday is an Australian award winning television show, that aired on the Nine Network on 11 February 1985 until 27 November 1998.
The local time when the sun is closest to its zenith
Noon; twelve o'clock during the day
Time of day when the sun is in its zenith.
Noon is usually defined as 12 o'clock in the daytime.
The time of noon; the time of day when the sun is highest in the sky, especially on a hot day.

bn:00001967n: A temporally organized plan for matters to be attended to
A temporally organized plan for matters to be attended to.

bn:00000020n: 12 is the natural number following 11 and preceding 13.
The cardinal number occurring after eleven and before thirteen, represented in Roman numerals as XII and in Arabic numerals as 12.
A dozen is a grouping of twelve.
The cardinal number that is the sum of eleven and one
The cardinal number occurring after eleven and before thirteen, represented in Arabic numerals as 12 and in Roman numerals as XII.

bn:00054884n: Midnight is the transition time period from one day to the next: the moment when the date changes.
The middle of the night: the moment of time, which is equidistant between sunset and sunrise.
Midnight is, in most systems, the transition time period from one day to the next: the moment when the date changes.
Transition time period from one day to the next
12 o'clock at night; the middle of the night
Point of time equidistant from sunset and sunrise.

bn:02436314n: 00, a double zero, may refer to.

bn:00077309n: A timer is a specialized type of clock for measuring time intervals.
An internal routine that causes the system to send a message whenever a specified interval elapses.
A mechanism that measures the remaining time from a preset amount of time and sounds an alarm when this time has elapsed.
A device used to measure amounts of time.
A mechanism that measures the duration of events, like calls, Internet time, etc.
A timepiece that measures a time interval and signals its end
Type of clock used to measure amount of time since or until a set time

bn:00019887n: A clock is an instrument to indicate, keep, and co-ordinate time.
A timepiece that shows the time of day
An instrument used to measure or keep track of time.
Instrument to measure or keep track of time.
An instrument used to measure or keep track of time; a non-portable timepiece.

apple_vendor_description: The twelve o'clock emoji on Apple devices is a clean, circular analog clock face, rendered with Apple's characteristic glossy 3D shading and smooth gradients. Its hands are precisely positioned at the top, indicating midnight or noon, with a crisp, minimalist design that emphasizes clarity. The subtle realistic lighting adds a touch of depth, making it feel like a real timepiece and is commonly used to denote specific times, deadlines, or a sense of punctuality in digital conversations.
